text:
[Rama points out to Lakshmana the evil portents indicating destruction of Rakshasas, monkeys, and people.]

निमित्तानिनिमित्ताज्ञोदृष्टवालक्ष्मणपूर्वजः ।

सौमित्रिंसम्परिष्वज्यइदंवचनमब्रवीत् ।।6.23.1।।
meaning: निमित्तज्ञः one who is aware of portents, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother, दृष्टवा perceiving, निमित्तानि portents, सौमित्रिम् to Saumithri, इदम् these, सम्परिष्वज्य embracing, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation: Perceiving the portents, Rama spoke these words embracing Saumithri who was aware of the portents.

meaning: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, शीतम् cool, उदकम् water, फलवन्ति fruit, वनानिच forests, परिगृह्य arranging, इदम् this, बलौघम् battalions of army, संविभज्य dividing, व्यूह्य the group, तिष्ठेम will remain.
translation: "Lakshmana Arrange a place in this forest where there is cool water and fruits for the battalions of the army, we shall remain (alert)."

meaning: लोकक्षयकरम् that which bodes destruction to the people, भीमम् dreadful, प्रवीराणाम् for the warriors, ऋक्षवानररक्षसाम् Bears, monkeys and Rakshasas, निबर्हणम् will be slain, भयम् fear, उपस्थितम् will happen, पश्यामि I foresee.
translation: "Dreadful warriors, Bears, monkeys, and Rakshasas will be slain, and I foresee that which bodes destruction of people."

meaning: वाताः wind, कलुषाः mixed with dust is blowing, वान्ति cracking, वसुन्धराच even the earth, कम्पते shaking, पर्वताग्राणि mountain tops, वेपन्ते breaking, महीरुहाः huge trees, पतन्तिच and falling down.
translation: "The wind is blowing mixed with dust, even the earth is cracking, mountain tops are shaking, and huge trees are breaking and falling down."

meaning: क्रव्यादसङ्काशाः clouds resembling raw flesh in colour, परुषाः harsh, परुषस्वनाः in harsh tone, क्रूराः cruel, मेघाः clouds, क्रूरम् frightening, शोणितबिन्दुभिः even drops of blood, मिश्रम् mixed, प्रवर्षन्ति raining.
translation: "Clouds resembling raw flesh in colour, are making harsh frightening sounds, and rain mixed with drops of blood."

meaning: रक्तचन्दनसङ्काशा like red sandal, सन्ध्या twilight, परमदारुणा very frightening, ज्वलतः blazing, आदित्यात् from the Sun, एतत of variegated colours, अग्निमण्डलम् , masses of fire प्रपतति raining.
translation: "The twilight in red sandal colour is very frightening. The Sun is blazing, raining masses of fire in variegated colours."

meaning: सर्वतः all over, क्रूराःमृगाः wild animals, दीनाः pathetic, दीनस्वराः wailing in low tone, महात् great, भयम् fear, जनयन्तः producing, प्रत्यादित्य opposite the Sun, विनर्धन्ति indicating.
translation: "The wild animals all over have a piteous look and wailing in low tone standing opposite the Sun is indicating fear."

meaning: लोकक्षये at the time of dissolution of the universe, उदितइव like the Sun, कृष्णरक्तांशपर्यन्तः with black rays around and red rays behind, चन्द्रमाः moon, रजन्याम् in the night, अप्रकाशः devoid of glow, सन्तापयति causing sorrow.
translation: "The moon devoid of glow even in the night is like the Sun with black rays around and red aura behind (the black)."

meaning: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, विमले white, आदित्ये Sun, ह्रस्वः becoming small, रूक्षः dreary, अप्रशस्तः that which had not been seen before, लोहितः copper coloured, परिवेषः around, नीलम् black, लक्ष्म in the centre, दृश्यते appears.
translation: "Lakshmana the white Sun is appearing in copper colour around with black colour in the centre which had not been seen before. It is small and dreary."

meaning: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, महता great, रजसा brightness, हतानि devoid, नक्षत्राणि the stars, लोकानाम् in the worlds, युगान्तम् end of universe at the time of dissolution, शंसन्तीव as if indicating, पश्य appears.
translation: "Lakshmana the stars devoid of brightness are indicating as though it is the time of dissolution of the universe?"

meaning: काकाः crows, श्येनाः hawks, ततागृध्राः likewise eagles, नीचाः small, परिपतन्ति falling down, शिवाश्चापि also jackals, महाभयान् great fear, अशिवान् creating, नादान् howls, नदन्ति making.
translation: "The crows, hawks and eagles are falling down like small animals. Also, the jackals are creating fear by making howls."

meaning: कपिराक्षसैः Vanaras and Rakshasas, विसृष्टैः hurled, शैलैः mountains, शूलैश्च tridents, खढगैश्च with swords, मांसशोणितकर्दमा covered with flesh and blood, भूमिः earth, आवृता turning to, भविष्यति will become.
translation: "The earth will turn into a mass of flesh and blood and will be covered by the mountains and tridents hurled by Vanaras and Rakshasas."

meaning: सर्वैः all, हरिभिः Vanaras, आवृताः turning direction, अद्यैव now itself, क्षिप्रम् immediately, जवेनैव swiftly, रावणपालिताम् ruled by Ravana, पुरीम् city, अभियाम will go.
translation: All the Vanaras turning their direction will go immediately and now itself, swiftly to the city ruled by Ravana (said Rama to Lakshmana).

meaning: रामः Rama, सङ्ग्रामधर्षणः one who subdues his enemies in war, विभुः a celebrated one, रामः Rama, इत्येवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, धनवी wielding a bow, पुरतः in front, लङ्काम् to Lanka, अभिमुखः towards, प्रतस्थे proceeded.
translation: Rama, the subduer of enemies in war, a celebrated one having spoken this way proceeded towards Lanka going in front wielding a bow.

meaning: सविभीषण then Vibheeshana, सुग्रीवाः Sugriva, सर्वे all, ते of them, वानरर्षभाः bulls among Vanaras, विनर्दन्तः roaring, निश्चितानाम् determined, द्विषताम् in the matter of, वधे slaying, प्रतस्थिरे went
translation: Then Vibheeshana, Sugriva and all bulls among Vanaras determined in the matter of slaying (the enemies) went roaring.

meaning: सुतरां excessively, वीर्यशालिनाम् heroes, हरीणाम् Vanaras, राघवस्य to Rama, प्रियार्थम् to make him happy, कर्मचेष्टाभिः actions, रघुपुङ्गवः the delight of Raghus, तुतोष saw and felt happy
translation:
To make Rama happy, the excessively heroic Vanaras made monkey actions. Seeing that Rama felt happy.
।। इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेत्रयोविंशस्सर्गः ।।
This is the end of the twenty third sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
